meanings.definition: A loud, raucous noise or cry.
meanings.sent1: The yaud of the thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The yaud of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent3: The yaud of the baby's laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The yaud of the wind through the trees sounded like a wild beast.
meanings.sent5: The yaud of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, raucous noise or cry.
meanings.sent1: The children yauded with excitement when they saw the circus.
meanings.sent2: The animals in the zoo often yaud during feeding time.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine yauded and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The protesters yauded slogans outside the government building.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks yauded in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
